snippet: One of New York City’s largest nonprofit job placement agencies claimed to have helped find jobs for at least 1,400 people in less than two years when in fact it had not.
abstract: New York City investigators discover evidence of large-scale fraud at Seedco, one of the agencies leading Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's signature initiative to find jobs for unemployed New Yorkers; finds that Seedco maintained a system for reporting false placements that led them to claim to have assisted over 1,400 people who were in fact unemployed or who had found jobs on their own.
lead_paragraph: One of New York City’s largest nonprofit job placement agencies claimed to have helped find jobs for at least 1,400 people in less than two years when in fact it had not.

headline.seo: Seedco, New York Job Agency, Is Accused of Filing False Job Claims
headline.main: Fraud Found in Jobs Effort; Blow to Bloomberg
headline.print_headline: Fraud Is Found In Jobs Effort; Blow to Mayor
